description:
Go to their web page and read. You may need to play with settings, but they get access to idle computer time to solve medical and scientific problems. 

For recognizing GPU, make sure you have latest drivers for your GPU. 
When it is running you can either use standard settings, or tune them to match your computer.
summary: Use up idle CPU time for scientific research

description: It should be obligatory for all computers in the world
You have to tweak the Settings to enable usage of CPU and it works. Uncheck Suspend when Computer is in use on the computer preferences and it will start to work.
Thanks to this app we can contribute to science without worrying about our privacy and security. Thanks BOINC.
The app works fine but it installs itself as a service. If you uninstall it the service remains and it's an absolute pig to uninstall.
summary: A secret services that MI5 would be proud of!

description: I had this running for year or so on 18.04; but when I upgraded to 20.04 it stopped and there was no notice. Since I had it set to only run tasks at night I didn't even realize there was a problem until I checked the tasks out of curiosity and saw a bunch that had expired/were past their deadline. I tried reinstalling but it didn't help. It's disappointing not to be able to contribute to my favorite projects any more.
summary: Used to work but stopped working completely after upgrading to 20.04

description: Don't know why but on this computer boinc does not work.
everything is flawless

So much for working when it idle...hmmm, nope!

I would have given this five stars in the past, but I noticed that the tasks are not being completed to the point they run past their deadline. The app doesn't take advantage of the fact the computer is idle. Either you have it crunching data, regardless if you are working on it or not, or you have it suspended, again regardless of its state. I reinstalled it, even when so far as to reformat and reinstall my operating system. Nothing helped. I tried to find if there were some workaround, to no avail. When will this problem be fixed? For me it's been going on since July 2020, five reformats and factory installs later it's still broken. At this point I don't think anyone cares.
After you install and when you boot up, you need to activate your daemon. Open up a terminal and type "/etc/init.d/boinc-client start" That should get it going for you when you start your manager.
This used to be good but I've just installed it on a brand new Kubuntu 20.10 install and it won't run - some rubbish about invalid passwords and I can't be bothered to sort it out. What a shame.

Ubuntu: 20.10.
After installed > Invalid client RPC password. Try reinstalling BOINC.

It worked on my Kubuntu 20.10 install. Now when I upgraded to 21.04 and tried to install BOINC, I get an error message where it cant start it (at least the GUI).

Launching BOINC Manager failed. 
chdir: Permission denied
Not functioning after install of BOINC metapackage and BOINC Manager. This application has been around for a very long time. Hopefully it will be made functional on this OS.

For those reviewers who say the BOINC app does not recognize their GPU, be aware that UBUNTU only automatically downloads the graphics drivers, but NOT the computational libraries .... without those, BOINC cannot use your GPU and tells you "No usable GPUs found". You need to install yourself the CUDA libraries if using Nvidia, and the OPENCL libraries if using AMD. There is a good method for AMD on the Einstein@home site, do a web search for "A quick guide: how to install opencl for AMD GPUs" and you should find it. CUDA is a bit more difficult, but there are guides available if you search.
I forgive linux for not working. I am very happy with all the new software and I will remain faithful.
Works out of the box on Ubuntu 20.04
summary: Works out of the box on Ubuntu 20.04

still broken as of Aug 10th, 2022 (22.04)
I like the app, it's just that it hasn't worked since upgrading to Ubuntu 22.04.1

Here we are 6 months after Jammy Jelly fish launcehd and still no operating BOINC.
What is the problem? is anyone working on it?

It's a bit exasperating that it took about 6 months to pull an update to fix a problem that wouldn't exist if the wrong version wasn't pulled to start, but I am glad it's finally up and runnung again in time to hit the coldest time of the year in the northern hemisphere when I actually want this computer to double as a space heater. It even displays more correctly than it did before! The news window still doesn't display anything but oh well.

Brand new Ubuntu install done JUST to run BOINC.
"What is the best way to install BOINC on Linux?"
"Use the app store."

This appears to be ONLY the BOINC manager and not the (required) client. It also will not RUN, giving the (briefly flashing) error "Failed to change to directory "/var/lib/boinc-client" (Permissi..."

This is a problem with "Ubuntu Software", not BOINC, because obviously there are thousands of people running BOINC successfully on Linux. Including me on systems set up before "Jammy Jellyfish."

I have this manager on my Ubuntu Gnome desktop and i am very happy with the response and identical setup to my Windows 11 desktop running the same software for BOINC. I enjoy volunteering and using BAM to make ease of the projects that i contribute to. I always use the "Advanced" view as it gives more details. I need to install my W9100 AMD GPU drivers because this program does not "see" my video card - but it's all good for now.

Will not launch after installation on Ubuntu 22.04. Error msg: Failed to change to directory "var/lib/boinc-client" (Permission denied)

See https://boinc.berkeley.edu/forum_thread.php?id=13946&postid=100575#100575 for details and resolution for explanation of issue on Ubuntu 18.04 including why GPU not being used due to permissions.

There is a good reddit article that you can also follow https://www.reddit.com/r/gridcoin/comments/12h0i4a/quick_guide_installing_boinc_on_linux_right_now/
I followed this procedure (but did not have a GPU so skipped the steps to enable GPU) and it worked well.

I also installed BOINC from this snap manager as well (virtual machine) and only had to follow the instructions from step 7 in the Reddit link above in the terminal:
*** your_user_name can be found by issuing the whoami command in the terminaland is needed in step 7
7. sudo usermod -aG boinc your_username_here
8. Restart the machine
9. sudo systemctl enable --now boinc-client
summary: Does not launch on Ubuntu 22.04 - also why GPU not running

description: I've been using this for years on different programs, and it's always a mystery how to get a project assigned and maintained. Now (Oct 2023) a fresh install does not list any Account Managers. I've given enough sweat to BOINC, I can't do any more.
Cannot get program to launch GUI in Ubuntu 22.04, either by command line install or from Ubuntu Software.
UPDATE THE VERSION! :-(
Which is a shame. The only reason I installed Ubuntu in the first place

When I started using BOINC on Linux (Ubuntu 18.04) GPUs (9500 GT and NVS 290) were working just fine (after some tweaking to let BOINC utilize all gpus).
Now it's 2024 and still no improvement on multiple GPU management, and projects are not using those GPUs and they are asking me to update GPU drivers. Well, those GPUs are obsolete and Nvidia will never update anything. It's too bad I can't use that power anymore.
summary: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS works fine... GPU issues
